overview.title: Gender-Inclusive Conversation Style Flow
overview.summary: A practical, ethical flowchart for talking with individuals based on observable communication styles (DT, IR, HE, LC, FA). Prioritizes consent, respect, and adaptability without relying on gender stereotypes.

nodes.title: Start
nodes.notes: Entry point for a gender-inclusive communication flow based on observed styles.

nodes.title: Conversation Initiated
nodes.notes: Trigger: a conversation begins; observe initial signals and context.

nodes.title: DT? Direct/Task-focused
nodes.notes: If yes, route to DT action; if no, proceed to next style check (IR).

nodes.title: DT - Direct/Task-focused
nodes.notes: Be concise about purpose; offer concrete next steps; example: propose a specific next action.

nodes.title: IR? Indirect/Relationship-focused
nodes.notes: If yes, route to IR action; if no, proceed to HE decision.

nodes.title: IR - Indirect/Relationship-focused
nodes.notes: Emphasize warmth, rapport-building; gradual sharing; focus on connection.

nodes.title: HE? High-context/Emotion-focused
nodes.notes: If yes, route to HE action; if no, proceed to LC decision.

nodes.title: HE - High-context/Emotion-focused
nodes.notes: Attend to nonverbal cues; mirror tone; minimize explicit statements when appropriate.

nodes.title: LC? Low-context/Content-focused
nodes.notes: If yes, route to LC action; if no, proceed to FA decision.

nodes.title: LC - Low-context/Content-focused
nodes.notes: Provide explicit details and straightforward options; avoid ambiguity.

nodes.title: FA? Flexible/Adaptive
nodes.notes: If yes, route to FA action; if no, proceed to End.

nodes.title: FA - Flexible/Adaptive
nodes.notes: Start with neutral framing; adapt on cues and feedback in real time.

nodes.title: End
nodes.notes: Conclude interaction; reflect on style fit and potential follow-up.
